meanings.definition: The state of being without a fence.
meanings.sent1: The fencelessness of the yard allowed the dog to roam freely.
meanings.sent2: The fencelessness of the property made it easy for the children to run around.
meanings.sent3: The fencelessness of the garden led to a surprise visit from a curious deer.
meanings.sent4: The fencelessness of the field made it seem endless, like a vast ocean of grass.
meanings.sent5: The fencelessness of the backyard made it feel spacious and unrestricted.

meanings.definition: The quality of lacking a barrier or boundary.
meanings.sent1: The fencelessness of the room made it feel open and airy.
meanings.sent2: The fencelessness of the park allowed for uninterrupted views of nature.
meanings.sent3: The fencelessness of the conversation led to unexpected honesty.
meanings.sent4: The fencelessness of the sky at night is a reminder of the vast universe beyond.
meanings.sent5: The fencelessness of the horizon made it seem like the world had no end.

meanings.definition: The condition of being open or unprotected.
meanings.sent1: The fencelessness of the border left the country vulnerable to invasion.
meanings.sent2: The fencelessness of the beach made it susceptible to strong winds.
meanings.sent3: The fencelessness of the fortress was a strategic weakness in battle.
meanings.sent4: The fencelessness of the forest allowed for easy exploration of its depths.
meanings.sent5: The fencelessness of the field exposed it to the elements without shelter.
